file_content.text: [The terminal is silent.]
All-clear signal transmitted. One all-clear signal remaining.
Belsavis Control reminds all staff that in an emergency, surveillance cameras may be hijacked by prisoners.
To ensure staff safety, surveillance cameras can be shut down manually at the following locations.
Remember, security is everyone's responsibility. Thank you.
I don't know what you did, Jedi, but nobody locks me out of my system.
I simply wished to find the Esh-kha without interference.
You made it necessary.
Challenging me was stupid.
Perhaps you're not as adept with Belsavis's computers as you thought.
Maybe you slipped up.
I've studied this prison for years. Every inch of it is mine!
The lockout was only the beginning of your problems.
Get used to it.
Sorry, the loophole just slammed shut.
I'm in charge here. And you're standing in a block of quarantine cells.
As in sick people? Ew! Tharan, cover your mouth!
So if I accidentally break the air filters, I guess all those disease-laden spores will go pouring back in.
Such an "accident" would not be fatal to a Jedi.
The spores wouldn't kill me.
Not right away, no.
Don't do it, Geland.
I'd welcome the chance to test myself.
Good, I'll be stronger for it.
Unfortunately, all the prisoners in this block will get the same treatment.
And they don't have a Jedi's constitution. I could release them before they get sick, but I just don't know what kind of mood they're in.
This is between us, Geland. Let the prisoners out.
Release them. Now.
I'm willing to risk it.
I'm not afraid. Let them go.
Just remember--only the very worst come to Belsavis.
Go ahead. They wouldn't be here unless they'd committed some heinous crime.
Leave them in their cell.
Judging and executing. Whatever would your Council say?
[The terminal is silent.]
